intro: Christella conspersa, commonly known as the rough christella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and spikes of small, tubular flowers. Christella conspersa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
